data.title: Southampton transfers: Denmark international Daniel Wass eyed as Man United target Nathaniel Clyne's potential replacement
data.meta_description: The Saints are still fighting to keep their England right-back but have also joined Stoke and Newcastle in watching 25-year-old who plays for France's Evian
data.text:
Southampton see Danish right-back Daniel Wass as a possible replacement if Nathaniel Clyne goes to Manchester United.

The Saints are among a number of clubs chasing the pacy and versatile 25-year-old, who plays for Evian in France's Ligue 1.

The talented wideman - who has 13 caps for his country and who can also play as a winger - is understood to be available for just Â£1.5million this summer, when he will have just a year left on his contract.

Stoke and Newcastle are also interested in the player, who has scored 23 goals in 125 league appearances since joining the French club on an initial loan deal four years ago.

Southampton are fighting to keep hold of Clyne, who has yet to sign a new deal with one year left on his contract.
